content: I’m a 3rd year PhD student studying statistics at Duke university under the supervision of Amy H. Herring and David Dunson. I have interests in statistical applications in the environmental and human health sciences. I develop Bayesian methods that provide better interpretation in relation to the reality along with uncertainty quantification. My current work focuses on chemical toxicity, pollutant effects on diseases, and spatial prevalence of hazardous chemicals.
summary: I’m a 3rd year PhD student studying statistics at Duke university under the supervision of Amy H. Herring and David Dunson. I have interests in statistical applications in the environmental and human health sciences.
title: Bora Jin
